events.message: Customer reported a rear-end collision involving their car on a busy highway during rush hour.
The claim was categorised as an Auto Accident based on the keywords and accident details provided.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle this vehicle accident claim for further processing.
Customer received formal acknowledgment that their car accident claim is under review.
Customer was requested to submit accident photos, police report, and vehicle registration documents.
All requested documents including images and official police report were submitted by the customer.
Investigator began examining the case details to verify the claim and assess vehicle damage.
The investigation confirmed the accident circumstances matched the customer's account with minor discrepancies.
An initial settlement offer was proposed covering repair costs and rental vehicle reimbursement.
Customer responded positively, accepting the settlement terms and expressing appreciation for the support.
The claim was officially approved based on investigation outcome and customer's acceptance.
Payment for the agreed settlement amount was issued to the customerâ€™s bank account successfully.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after payment issuance and final confirmation with the customer.
All related case files and correspondence were archived in the insurance system for future reference.
